intro: Vernonia colorata subsp. oxyura, commonly known as the narrowleaf ironweed, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the sunflower family (Asteraceae) and is characterized by its upright growth habit and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The plant produces clusters of small, yellow to orange flowers that bloom in late summer to early fall. It thrives in full sun and well-drained soils, often found in open woodlands and prairies. Its ornamental value makes it a popular choice for native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
